intro: Ardisia spicigera, commonly known as the fragrant evergreen ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible for humans but can be toxic to some animals. Ardisia spicigera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal floral display. It thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments and prefers moist, well-drained soil.
